summary: This document appears to be a transcript excerpt from a deposition or interview where a corrections officer (Ms. Noel) describes systemic problems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), including being ordered to falsify documents by supervisors, chronic understaffing, and excessive work hours leading to dangerous conditions.

persons.name: Ms. Noel
persons.context: A corrections officer at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) who is testifying about being ordered to falsify documents by supervisors, chronic understaffing, and being forced to work 16-hour shifts.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: A supervisor at MCC who was promoted despite allegedly ordering officers to falsify documents.

connections.description: Ms. Noel reports that the Lieutenant, her supervisor, ordered her to falsify documents and was later promoted.

keyFacts: A corrections officer (Ms. Noel) testifies that supervisors at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) ordered staff to falsify documents.
The officer states that supervisors who gave such orders were promoted, while the officers who complied got in trouble.
The officer describes chronic understaffing and being forced to work 16-hour shifts, leading to exhaustion and falling asleep while driving home.
The testimony blames systemic problems at MCC on poor management from the top down and lack of manpower.
